title: How to Conduct a Stake Out

steps.headline: Be unnoticed.
steps.description: Conduct the stakeout from a rented car. If you use your own, you may be noticed. Try to find one with tinted windows.

steps.headline: Conduct a "spot check" of the location by driving by once, and get a perspective of the area before permanently setting up your position.
Park on the opposite side of the street' from the place you're surveying.
steps.description: This will make you less noticeable to people.

steps.headline: Jump in the back seat, if your vehicle has tint you'll be less noticeable.
Bring a friend or two to help.
steps.description: They may notice something you don't, and it's best to have more than one for other circumstances.

steps.headline: Try to notice any suspicious activity coming from the person or building you are observing.
steps.description: Record whatever you see so you have visual evidence of the person or people you are looking at.

tyn: Water or some kind of other drinks
A couple excuses on why you are there
In many cases, a lot of time
